gurmukhi: qb iek m`C lIl quih lXo ] so BI m`C Pws bis BXo ] JIvr iPr sMbr pY ilAwXo ] iqh hm pY B`Cn ihq idAwXo ]2021]
transliteration: Tah Ik Machchh Leel Tuh(i) Layo|| So Bhimachchh Phaas Bas(i) Bhayo|| Jheevar Phir Sanbar Pai Liaayo|| Tih Ham Pai Bhachchhan Hit Diaayo||2021||
translation: “Then a fish had swallowed you and that fish was also caught; the fisherman brought it to Shambar, where he sent it to me for cooking.2021.

gurmukhi: jb hm pyt m`C ko PwrXo ] qb qoih kau mY nYn inhwrXo ] mory hiRdy dieAw Aiq AweI ] Aau nwrd ieh BwNq sunweI ]2022]
transliteration: Jab Ham Pet Machchh Ko Phdaryo|| Tab Hoh(i) Kau Mai Nain Nihdaryo|| More Hride Daiaa At(i) Aaee|| Au Naarad Eh Bhaant Sounaaee||2022||
translation: “When I tore open the belely of the fish, I saw you there; my; mind became pitiful and at the same time Narada said to me.2022.

gurmukhi: ieh Avqwr mdn ko AwrI ] FUMFq iPrq rYn idn jwrI ] mY piq liK quih syvw krI ] Ab mY mdn kQw icq DrI ]2023]
transliteration: Eh Avtaar Madan Ko Daree|| Dhoondhat Phirat Rain Din Jdaree|| Maipati Lakh(i) Tuh(i) Sevaa Daree|| Ab Mai Madan Kathaa Chit Ddaree||2023||
translation: “That he is the incarnation of Kamadeva (the god of love), whom you seek day and night; I have served you, considering you as my husband and seeing you now I am under the impact of sexual desire.2023.

gurmukhi: rudR kop kwNieAw quih jrI ] qb mY pUjw iSv kI krI ] bru iSv dXo hulws bFY hY ] Brqw vhI mUrq qU pY hY ]2024]
transliteration: Rudra Kop Kaaniaa Tuh(i) Daree|| Tab Mai Poojaa Shiv Kidaree|| Bar(u) Shiv Dayo Hulaas Badhai Hai|| Bhartaa Vahimoondat Too Pai Hai||2024||
translation: “When, because of Shiva’s anger, your body was burnt to ashes, then I had meditated on Shiva, who, getting pleased, had bestowed on me this boon that the same husband would be attained by me.”2024.

gurmukhi: qb hau sMbr dYq kI BeI rsoien Awie ] Ab Brqw muih rudR qUM suMdr dXo bnwie ]2025]
transliteration: Tab Hau Sanbar Dit Kibhairasoin Aae|| Ab Bhartaa Muhe Rudra Toon Soundar Dayo Banaae||2025||
translation: “Then I became a kitchenmaid of Shambar; now Shiva has made you the same charming one.”2025.

gurmukhi: suq kwnH ky XO bqIXw suin kY Apny icq mY Aiq kRoD bFwXo ] bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw gih kY Air ky bD kwrn DwXo ]
transliteration: Sout Kaahn Ke You Bateeyaa Soun(i) Kai Apne Chit Mai At(i) Krodh Badhaayo|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa Gadh Kai Ar(i) Ke Badh Kaaran Dhaayo||
translation: Hearing these words, the son of Krishna got extremely enraged and catching hold of bow, arrows and mace moved to kill the enemy;

gurmukhi: Dwm jhw iqh bYrI ko Qo iqh dÍwr pY jie kY bYn sunwXo ] jwih kau isMD pY fwr dXo Ab so quih so lrby khu AwXo ]2026]
transliteration: Dhaan Jahaa Tih Bairiko Tho Tih Dvaar Pai Jaae Kai Bain Sounaayo|| Jaah(i) Kau Sindh Pai Daar Dayo Ab So Tuh(i) So Larbe Kauh Aayo||2016||
translation: He began to challenge the enemy on reaching his place, “The one whom you had thrown into the sea, has now come to fight with you.2026.

gurmukhi: Xo jb bYn khY suq sXwm qO sMbr SsqR gdw gih AwXo ] jYsy khI ibiD ju`Dih kI iqh BwNq so qw hI ny ju`D mcwXo ]
transliteration: Yo Jab Bain Kahai Sout Syaam Tau Sanbar Shastra Gadaa Gadh Aayo|| Jaise Kahibidh(i) Juddhah(i) Kitih Bhaant So Taa Hine Juddh Machadyo||
translation: When the son of Krishna uttered these words, then Shamber came forward holding his weapons including the mace; he began the fight, keeping before him the norms of fighting;

gurmukhi: Awp BjXo nih qw BUA qy kih vwih kau qRws dY pYgu BjwXo ] Awhv Xw ibiD hoq BXo kih kY ieh BwNq so sXwm sunwXo ]2027]
transliteration: Oop Bhajyo Nah(i) Taa Bhooaa Te Kah(i) Vaah(i) Kau Traas Dai Paig(u) Bhajaayo|| Oohavv Yaa Biddh(i) Hot Bhayo Kah(i) Kai Eh Bhant So Syaam Sounaayo||2027||
translation: He did not run away from the battle and began to frighten Pradyumna in order to restrain him from fighting; according to the poet Shyam, in this way, this battle continued there.2027.
